subject: Basketball
lead_paragraph: Sacramento Kings forward Shareef Abdur-Rahim announced his retirement because of a persistent right knee injury. Abdur-Rahim, 31, played for four teams during his 12 N.B.A. seasons. He began his career in 1996, when the Vancouver Grizzlies made him the third overall draft pick. Abdur-Rahim, an All-Star in 2002, averaged 18.1 points, 7.5 rebounds and 2.5 assists in his career. He reached the playoffs once, with the Kings in 2006.
